edge_1: In the mind of a young girl named Riley Andersen are a series of personified basic emotions that influence her actions: Joy, Anger, Fear, Disgust, and Sadness. Joy acts as the leader, and tries to limit Sadness's influence, perceiving her as an unnecessary burden for Riley.
edge_2: At first, Riley has poor experiences: the new house is cramped and old; her father hardly has any time for Riley; a local pizza parlor only serves pizza topped with broccoli, which she dislikes; and the moving van with their belongings was misdirected to Texas and will not arrive for weeks. Sadness retroactively saddens joyous memories, causing Riley to cry in front of her class, much to the shock of Joy, Anger, Disgust, and Fear. This also creates Riley's first sad core memory.
edge_3: In the mind of a young girl named Riley Andersen are a series of personified basic emotions that influence her actions: Joy, Anger, Fear, Disgust, and Sadness. Joy acts as the leader, and tries to limit Sadness's influence, perceiving her as an unnecessary burden for Riley.

edge_2: At first, Riley has poor experiences: the new house is cramped and old; her father hardly has any time for Riley; a local pizza parlor only serves pizza topped with broccoli, which she dislikes; and the moving van with their belongings was misdirected to Texas and will not arrive for weeks. Sadness retroactively saddens joyous memories, causing Riley to cry in front of her class, much to the shock of Joy, Anger, Disgust, and Fear. This also creates Riley's first sad core memory.
edge_3: Joy tries to dispose of the memory using a pneumatic tube, but accidentally knocks loose the other core memories during a struggle with Sadness, disabling the personality islands. Joy, Sadness, and the core memories are subsequently sucked out of Headquarters.

edge_3: Joy and Bing Bong try to use his song-fueled wagon rocket to escape the Memory Dump, but are unable to fully ascend due to their combined weight.

edge_1: Joy breaks down crying and she discovers a sad memory of losing a hockey game that turned happy when Riley's parents and friends comforted her, and realizes Sadness's purpose in alerting others when Riley is emotionally overwhelmed and needs help.
edge_2: To the surprise of the others, Joy hands control of the console to Sadness, who is able to reactivate it and return Riley to her parents.
edge_3: Given a newly expanded console that has enough room for all of them to work together as a team,
